018package com.scivicslab.actoriac.log;
019
020import java.nio.file.Path;
021import java.sql.*;
022import java.time.LocalDateTime;
023import java.util.ArrayList;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue;
026import java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue;
027import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean;
028
029/**
030 * H2 Database implementation of DistributedLogStore.
031 *
032 * <p>Uses H2 embedded database for storing logs from distributed workflow
033 * execution. Supports concurrent access from multiple threads and provides
034 * efficient querying by node, level, and time.</p>
035 *
036 * <p>Features:</p>
037 * <ul>
038 *   <li>Pure Java - no native dependencies</li>
039 *   <li>Single file storage (.mv.db)</li>
040 *   <li>Asynchronous batch writing for performance</li>
041 *   <li>SQL-based querying</li>
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * @author devteam@scivics-lab.com
045 */
046public class H2LogStore implements DistributedLogStore {
047
048    private final Connection connection;
049    private final BlockingQueue<LogTask> writeQueue;
050    private final Thread writerThread;
051    private final AtomicBoolean running;
052    private static final int BATCH_SIZE = 100;
053
054    /**
055     * Creates an H2LogStore with the specified database path.
056     *
057     * @param dbPath path to the database file (without extension)
058     * @throws SQLException if database connection fails
059     */
060    public H2LogStore(Path dbPath) throws SQLException {
061        // AUTO_SERVER=TRUE allows multiple processes to access the same DB
062        // First process starts embedded server, others connect via TCP
063        String url = "jdbc:h2:" + dbPath.toAbsolutePath().toString() + ";AUTO_SERVER=TRUE";
064        this.connection = DriverManager.getConnection(url);
065        this.writeQueue = new LinkedBlockingQueue<>();
066        this.running = new AtomicBoolean(true);
067
068        initSchema();
069
070        // Start async writer thread
071        this.writerThread = new Thread(this::writerLoop, "H2LogStore-Writer");
072        this.writerThread.setDaemon(true);
073        this.writerThread.start();
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Creates an in-memory H2LogStore (for testing).
078     *
079     * @throws SQLException if database connection fails
080     */
081    public H2LogStore() throws SQLException {
082        // Use unique DB name per instance to avoid test interference
083        String url = "jdbc:h2:mem:testdb_" + System.nanoTime() + ";DB_CLOSE_DELAY=-1";
084        this.connection = DriverManager.getConnection(url);
085        this.writeQueue = new LinkedBlockingQueue<>();
086        this.running = new AtomicBoolean(true);
087
088        initSchema();
089
090        this.writerThread = new Thread(this::writerLoop, "H2LogStore-Writer");
091        this.writerThread.setDaemon(true);
092        this.writerThread.start();
093    }
094
095    private void initSchema() throws SQLException {
096        try (Statement stmt = connection.createStatement()) {
097            // Sessions table
098            stmt.execute("""
099                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS sessions (
100                    id IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
101                    started_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
102                    ended_at TIMESTAMP,
103                    workflow_name VARCHAR(255),
104                    overlay_name VARCHAR(255),
105                    inventory_name VARCHAR(255),
106                    node_count INT,
107                    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'RUNNING'
108                )
109                """);
110
111            // Add columns if they don't exist (migration for existing databases)
112            try {
113                stmt.execute("ALTER TABLE sessions ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS overlay_name VARCHAR(255)");
114                stmt.execute("ALTER TABLE sessions ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS inventory_name VARCHAR(255)");
115            } catch (SQLException e) {
116                // Ignore if columns already exist
117            }
118
119            // Logs table
120            // vertex_name and action_name use CLOB to store long YAML snippets
121            stmt.execute("""
122                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS logs (
123                    id IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
124                    session_id BIGINT,
125                    timestamp TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
126                    node_id VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
127                    vertex_name CLOB,
128                    action_name CLOB,
129                    level VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL,
130                    message CLOB,
131                    exit_code INT,
132                    duration_ms BIGINT,
133                    FOREIGN KEY (session_id) REFERENCES sessions(id)
134                )
135                """);
136
137            // Node results table
138            stmt.execute("""
139                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS node_results (
140                    id IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
141                    session_id BIGINT,
142                    node_id VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
143                    status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
144                    reason VARCHAR(1000),
145                    FOREIGN KEY (session_id) REFERENCES sessions(id),
146                    UNIQUE (session_id, node_id)
147                )
148                """);
149
150            // Indexes
151            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_logs_session ON logs(session_id)");
152            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_logs_node ON logs(node_id)");
153            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_logs_level ON logs(level)");
154            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_logs_timestamp ON logs(timestamp)");
155            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_sessions_workflow ON sessions(workflow_name)");
156            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_sessions_overlay ON sessions(overlay_name)");
157            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_sessions_inventory ON sessions(inventory_name)");
158            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_sessions_started ON sessions(started_at)");
159        }
160    }
161
162    private void writerLoop() {
163        List<LogTask> batch = new ArrayList<>(BATCH_SIZE);
164        while (running.get() || !writeQueue.isEmpty()) {
165            try {
166                LogTask task = writeQueue.poll(100, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
167                if (task != null) {
168                    batch.add(task);
169                    writeQueue.drainTo(batch, BATCH_SIZE - 1);
170                    processBatch(batch);
171                    batch.clear();
172                }
173            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
174                Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
175                break;
176            }
177        }
178        // Process remaining
179        if (!batch.isEmpty()) {
180            processBatch(batch);
181        }
182    }
183
184    private void processBatch(List<LogTask> batch) {
185        try {
186            connection.setAutoCommit(false);
187            for (LogTask task : batch) {
188                task.execute(connection);
189            }
190            connection.commit();
191            connection.setAutoCommit(true);
192        } catch (SQLException e) {
193            try {
194                connection.rollback();
195                connection.setAutoCommit(true);
196            } catch (SQLException ex) {
197                // Ignore rollback errors
198            }
199            e.printStackTrace();
200        }
201    }
202
203    @Override
204    public long startSession(String workflowName, int nodeCount) {
205        return startSession(workflowName, null, null, nodeCount);
206    }
207
208    @Override
209    public long startSession(String workflowName, String overlayName, String inventoryName, int nodeCount) {
210        try (PreparedStatement ps = connection.prepareStatement(
211                "INSERT INTO sessions (workflow_name, overlay_name, inventory_name, node_count) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?)",
212                Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS)) {
213            ps.setString(1, workflowName);
214            ps.setString(2, overlayName);
215            ps.setString(3, inventoryName);
216            ps.setInt(4, nodeCount);
217            ps.executeUpdate();
218            try (ResultSet rs = ps.getGeneratedKeys()) {
219                if (rs.next()) {
220                    return rs.getLong(1);
221                }
222            }
223        } catch (SQLException e) {
224            throw new RuntimeException("Failed to start session", e);
225        }
226        return -1;
227    }
228
229    @Override
230    public void log(long sessionId, String nodeId, LogLevel level, String message) {
231        log(sessionId, nodeId, null, level, message);
232    }
233
234    @Override
235    public void log(long sessionId, String nodeId, String vertexName, LogLevel level, String message) {
236        writeQueue.offer(new LogTask.InsertLog(sessionId, nodeId, vertexName, null, level, message, null, null));
237    }
238
239    @Override
240    public void logAction(long sessionId, String nodeId, String vertexName,
241                          String actionName, int exitCode, long durationMs, String output) {
242        LogLevel level = exitCode == 0 ? LogLevel.INFO : LogLevel.ERROR;
243        writeQueue.offer(new LogTask.InsertLog(sessionId, nodeId, vertexName, actionName, level, output, exitCode, durationMs));
244    }
245
246    @Override
247    public void markNodeSuccess(long sessionId, String nodeId) {
248        writeQueue.offer(new LogTask.UpdateNodeResult(sessionId, nodeId, "SUCCESS", null));
249    }
250
251    @Override
252    public void markNodeFailed(long sessionId, String nodeId, String reason) {
253        writeQueue.offer(new LogTask.UpdateNodeResult(sessionId, nodeId, "FAILED", reason));
254    }
255
256    @Override
257    public void endSession(long sessionId, SessionStatus status) {
258        // Flush pending writes
259        flushWrites();
260
261        try (PreparedStatement ps = connection.prepareStatement(
262                "UPDATE sessions SET ended_at = CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, status = ? WHERE id = ?")) {
263            ps.setString(1, status.name());
264            ps.setLong(2, sessionId);
265            ps.executeUpdate();
266        } catch (SQLException e) {
267            throw new RuntimeException("Failed to end session", e);
268        }
269    }
270
271    private void flushWrites() {
272        // Wait for queue to drain
273        while (!writeQueue.isEmpty()) {
274            try {
275                Thread.sleep(10);
276            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
277                Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
278                break;
279            }
280        }
281    }
282
283    @Override
284    public List<LogEntry> getLogsByNode(long sessionId, String nodeId) {
285        List<LogEntry> entries = new ArrayList<>();
286        try (PreparedStatement ps = connection.prepareStatement(
287                "SELECT * FROM logs WHERE session_id = ? AND node_id = ? ORDER BY timestamp")) {
288            ps.setLong(1, sessionId);
289            ps.setString(2, nodeId);
290            try (ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery()) {
291                while (rs.next()) {
292                    entries.add(mapLogEntry(rs));
293                }
294            }
295        } catch (SQLException e) {
296            throw new RuntimeException("Failed to query logs", e);
297        }
298        return entries;
299    }
300
301    @Override
302    public List<LogEntry> getLogsByLevel(long sessionId, LogLevel minLevel) {
303        List<LogEntry> entries = new ArrayList<>();
304        try (PreparedStatement ps = connection.prepareStatement(
305                "SELECT * FROM logs WHERE session_id = ? AND level IN (?, ?, ?, ?) ORDER BY timestamp")) {
306            ps.setLong(1, sessionId);
307            int idx = 2;
308            for (LogLevel level : LogLevel.values()) {
309                if (level.isAtLeast(minLevel)) {
310                    ps.setString(idx++, level.name());
311                } else {
312                    ps.setString(idx++, "NONE"); // Placeholder
313                }
314            }
315            try (ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery()) {
316                while (rs.next()) {
317                    entries.add(mapLogEntry(rs));
318                }
319            }
320        } catch (SQLException e) {
321            throw new RuntimeException("Failed to query logs", e);
322        }
323        return entries;
324    }
325
326    @Override
327    public SessionSummary getSummary(long sessionId) {
328        try {
329            // Get session info
330            String workflowName = null;
331            String overlayName = null;
332            String inventoryName = null;
333            LocalDateTime startedAt = null;
334            LocalDateTime endedAt = null;
335            int nodeCount = 0;
336            SessionStatus status = SessionStatus.RUNNING;
337
338            try (PreparedStatement ps = connection.prepareStatement(
339                    "SELECT * FROM sessions WHERE id = ?")) {
340                ps.setLong(1, sessionId);
341                try (ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery()) {
342                    if (rs.next()) {
343                        workflowName = rs.getString("workflow_name");
344                        overlayName = rs.getString("overlay_name");
345                        inventoryName = rs.getString("inventory_name");
346                        Timestamp ts = rs.getTimestamp("started_at");
347                        startedAt = ts != null ? ts.toLocalDateTime() : null;
348                        ts = rs.getTimestamp("ended_at");
349                        endedAt = ts != null ? ts.toLocalDateTime() : null;
350                        nodeCount = rs.getInt("node_count");
351                        String statusStr = rs.getString("status");
352                        if (statusStr != null) {
353                            status = SessionStatus.valueOf(statusStr);
354                        }
355                    }
356                }
357            }
358
359            // Get node results
360            int successCount = 0;
361            int failedCount = 0;
362            List<String> failedNodes = new ArrayList<>();
363
364            try (PreparedStatement ps = connection.prepareStatement(
365                    "SELECT node_id, status FROM node_results WHERE session_id = ?")) {
366                ps.setLong(1, sessionId);
367                try (ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery()) {
368                    while (rs.next()) {
369                        String nodeStatus = rs.getString("status");
370                        if ("SUCCESS".equals(nodeStatus)) {
371                            successCount++;
372                        } else {
373                            failedCount++;
374                            failedNodes.add(rs.getString("node_id"));
375                        }
376                    }
377                }
378            }
379
380            // Get log counts
381            int totalLogEntries = 0;
382            int errorCount = 0;
383
384            try (PreparedStatement ps = connection.prepareStatement(
385                    "SELECT COUNT(*) as total, SUM(CASE WHEN level = 'ERROR' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) as errors " +
386                    "FROM logs WHERE session_id = ?")) {
387                ps.setLong(1, sessionId);
388                try (ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery()) {
389                    if (rs.next()) {
390                        totalLogEntries = rs.getInt("total");
391                        errorCount = rs.getInt("errors");
392                    }
393                }
394            }
395
396            return new SessionSummary(sessionId, workflowName, overlayName, inventoryName,
397                    startedAt, endedAt, nodeCount, status, successCount, failedCount,
398                    failedNodes, totalLogEntries, errorCount);
399
400        } catch (SQLException e) {
401            throw new RuntimeException("Failed to get session summary", e);
402        }
403    }
404
405    @Override
406    public long getLatestSessionId() {
407        try (Statement stmt = connection.createStatement();
408             ResultSet rs = stmt.executeQuery("SELECT MAX(id) FROM sessions")) {
409            if (rs.next()) {
410                return rs.getLong(1);
411            }
412        } catch (SQLException e) {
413            throw new RuntimeException("Failed to get latest session", e);
414        }
415        return -1;
416    }
417
418    @Override
419    public List<SessionSummary> listSessions(int limit) {
420        List<SessionSummary> sessions = new ArrayList<>();
421        try (PreparedStatement ps = connection.prepareStatement(
422                "SELECT id FROM sessions ORDER BY started_at DESC LIMIT ?")) {
423            ps.setInt(1, limit);
424            try (ResultSet rs = ps.executeQuery()) {
425                while (rs.next()) {
426                    sessions.add(getSummary(rs.getLong("id")));
427                }
428            }
429        } catch (SQLException e) {
430            throw new RuntimeException("Failed to list sessions", e);
431        }
432        return sessions;
433    }
434
435    private LogEntry mapLogEntry(ResultSet rs) throws SQLException {
436        Timestamp ts = rs.getTimestamp("timestamp");
437        Integer exitCode = rs.getObject("exit_code") != null ? rs.getInt("exit_code") : null;
438        Long durationMs = rs.getObject("duration_ms") != null ? rs.getLong("duration_ms") : null;
439        String levelStr = rs.getString("level");
440        LogLevel level = levelStr != null ? LogLevel.valueOf(levelStr) : LogLevel.INFO;
441
442        return new LogEntry(
443                rs.getLong("id"),
444                rs.getLong("session_id"),
445                ts != null ? ts.toLocalDateTime() : null,
446                rs.getString("node_id"),
447                rs.getString("vertex_name"),
448                rs.getString("action_name"),
449                level,
450                rs.getString("message"),
451                exitCode,
452                durationMs
453        );
454    }
455
456    @Override
457    public void close() throws Exception {
458        running.set(false);
459        writerThread.interrupt();
460        try {
461            writerThread.join(5000);
462        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
463            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
464        }
465        connection.close();
466    }
467
468    // Internal task classes for async writing
469    private interface LogTask {
470        void execute(Connection conn) throws SQLException;
471
472        record InsertLog(long sessionId, String nodeId, String vertexName, String actionName,
473                         LogLevel level, String message, Integer exitCode, Long durationMs) implements LogTask {
474            @Override
475            public void execute(Connection conn) throws SQLException {
476                try (PreparedStatement ps = conn.prepareStatement(
477                        "INSERT INTO logs (session_id, node_id, vertex_name, action_name, level, message, exit_code, duration_ms) " +
478                        "VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)")) {
479                    ps.setLong(1, sessionId);
480                    ps.setString(2, nodeId);
481                    ps.setString(3, vertexName);
482                    ps.setString(4, actionName);
483                    ps.setString(5, level.name());
484                    ps.setString(6, message);
485                    if (exitCode != null) {
486                        ps.setInt(7, exitCode);
487                    } else {
488                        ps.setNull(7, Types.INTEGER);
489                    }
490                    if (durationMs != null) {
491                        ps.setLong(8, durationMs);
492                    } else {
493                        ps.setNull(8, Types.BIGINT);
494                    }
495                    ps.executeUpdate();
496                }
497            }
498        }
499
500        record UpdateNodeResult(long sessionId, String nodeId, String status, String reason) implements LogTask {
501            @Override
502            public void execute(Connection conn) throws SQLException {
503                try (PreparedStatement ps = conn.prepareStatement(
504                        "MERGE INTO node_results (session_id, node_id, status, reason) KEY (session_id, node_id) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?)")) {
505                    ps.setLong(1, sessionId);
506                    ps.setString(2, nodeId);
507                    ps.setString(3, status);
508                    ps.setString(4, reason);
509                    ps.executeUpdate();
510                }
511            }
512        }
513    }
514}
